overview: From 2025-10-19 to 2025-10-20, ethereum-optimism/optimism had 4 new PRs (1 merged), 1 new issues, and 11 active contributors.

topIssues.title: Prevent setting implementation for reserved game types in DisputeGameFactory
topIssues.author: ajsutton
topIssues.body: As per https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17832#discussion_r2429556986 `DisputeGameFacotry.setImplementation` should be what enforces that games can't be created with the reserved game type.

topIssues.title: op-conductor :Failed to start sequencer, err="no unsafe head"
topIssues.author: wluisw
topIssues.body: I originally deployed a sequencer to generate blocks normally. 1. After I linked the conductor, the sequencer stopped generating blocks: op-node log conductor log: 2. The log after I called the conductor conductor_resume rpc interfaceï¼š 3. Config op-node : ```# Sequencer configuration SEQUENCER_ENABLED=true SEQUENCER_STOPPED=false OP_NODE_P2P_NO_DISCOVERY=true OP_NODE_CONDUCTOR_ENABLED=true OP_NODE_CONDUCTOR_RPC=http://127.0.0.1:9547 ``` op-conductor: ```OP_CONDUCTOR_CONSENSUS_ADDR=0.0.0.0 OP_CONDUCTOR_CONSENSUS_ADVERTISED=127.0.0.1:50050 OP_CONDUCTOR_CONSENSUS_PORT=50050 OP_CONDUCTOR_EXECUTION_RPC=http://127.0.0.1:8545 OP_CONDUCTOR_HEALTHCHECK_INTERVAL=1 OP_CONDUCTOR_HEALTHCHECK_MIN_PEER_COUNT=2 OP_CONDUCTOR_HEALTHCHECK_UNSAFE_INTERVAL=60 OP_CONDUCTOR_NODE_RPC=http://127.0.0.1:8547 OP_CONDUCTOR_RAFT_SERVER_ID=conductor0 OP_CONDUCTOR_RAFT_STORAGE_DIR=./raft OP_CONDUCTOR_RPC_ENABLE_PROXY=true OP_CONDUCTOR_RPC_ENABLE_ADMIN=true OP_CONDUCTOR_RAFT_BOOTSTRAP=true OP_CONDUCTOR_PAUSED=true OP_CONDUCTOR_RPC_PORT=9547 OP_CONDUCTOR_RPC_ADDR=0.0.0.0 OP_CONDUCTORHEALTHCHECK_MIN_PEER_COUNT=1 ``` Can someone help me see what the reason is? Thank you very much.

topIssues.title: opcm: Avoid mocking in test_addGameType_permissionedSuper_succeeds
topIssues.author: ajsutton
topIssues.body: Update `test_addGameType_permissionedSuper_succeeds` to actually run `migrate` before attempting to add super games so the mocking isn't required. Other tests for adding super game types should probably run migrate first as well to setup the situation they are actually expected to work in.

topPRs.title: proofs: Pass game type as a CWIA arg instead of a constructor arg
topPRs.author: ajsutton
topPRs.body:
**Description**

V2 fault dispute game contracts no longer take the game type as a constructor arg, allowing a single FaultDisputeGame deployment to be used for both cannon and cannon-kona.  DisputeGameFactory passes the game type as part of the CWIA args automatically.

The change is feature toggled with the game type only being passed through if the game args added in creator pattern are non-zero length.  So existing IDisputeGame implementations are unaffected.

**Tests**

Updated tests.

**Additional context**

Builds on https://github.com/ethereum-optimism/optimism/pull/17782

**Metadata**

#17260

topPRs.title: fix: resolve flaky acceptance tests during initialization
topPRs.author: avorylli
topPRs.body:
## Problem
Issue #17084

Acceptance tests were failing intermittently during initialization with:
- 404 errors when getting balance from faucet
- "Waiting for online" timeouts when L1 network couldn't connect to EL node

## Root Cause
Race conditions during system initialization where tests tried to use services before they were fully ready.

## Solution
- Enhanced EL node readiness checks with increased timeouts (10s â†’ 30s)
- Added pre-flight checks before balance requests
- Increased faucet retry attempts (3 â†’ 5)
- Added explicit network readiness checks in tests
- Improved synchronization with safety delays
- Added retry utilities for better error handling

## Files Changed
- `op-devstack/dsl/eoa.go` - Enhanced balance lookup
- `op-devstack/dsl/el.go` - Improved readiness checks
- `op-devstack/dsl/faucet.go` - Enhanced retry logic
- `op-devstack/dsl/funder.go` - Added safety delays
- `op-devstack/dsl/retry_utils.go` - New retry utilities
- `op-acceptance-tests/tests/base/faucet_test.go` - Added readiness checks
- `op-acceptance-tests/tests/base/deposit/deposit_test.go` - Added readiness checks

topPRs.title: fix(Makefile): remove Makefile sharding; rely on (op-e2e) in-test sharding
topPRs.author: scharissis

topPRs.title: fix(op-chain-ops): use correct file permissions for debug_witness.json
topPRs.author: anim001k
topPRs.body:
## Description
The `debug_witness.json` file was being created with executable permissions (`0755`) instead of standard read-write permissions for data files.

### Solution
Changed file permissions from `0755` to `0644` when writing the debug witness JSON file.
